page.title: 03The School(1)
page.content: A school has existed in the village since 1865, when the building now used as the school hall was constructed. It was a single roomed structure on traditional lines, and externally little changed today. In 1927 the 'new school' was opened, doubling the existing accomodation to 4 classrooms, two in the old building and two in the new. Contemporary reports talk of a considerable ugrading in the standard of accommodation! A staffroom block with two further classrooms was opened in 1950. With the addition of land at the back of the church to form a school field and the old Rectory stable block, suitably converted, we have the present main establishment of 6 classrooms, plus hall.
